description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ea2rn","text":"Calcium chloride (CaCl2) transformation is a laboratory technique in prokaryotic (bacterial) cell biology. The addition of calcium chloride to a cell suspension promotes the binding of plasmid DNA to lipopolysaccharides (LPS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":22,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Transformation, cacl2, calcium chloride method, E. coli

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working
